items.title: Leveraging tax credits and incentives for sustainability projects

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Randa Barsoum, Tax Partner at PwC US, outlines tax credits and incentives for sustainability that go beyond energy-focused programs. She highlights state and local abatements, location-based incentives, and R&D tax credits tied to innovation (for example, reimagining packaging or processes), and emphasizes that viewing sustainability investments through a broader lens can unlock meaningful tax value.
bullets: Energy incentives are common but only part of the tax picture for sustainability.
State and local abatements can provide additional tax relief for sustainability projects.
Location-based incentives may influence project siting and economics.
R&D tax credits can apply to innovation efforts, such as reimagining packaging or processes.
Broad tax-focused view of sustainability investments can unlock meaningful tax value.
takeaways: When evaluating site decisions, factor in location-based incentives as part of total project economics.
Seek state and local abatements to lower upfront or ongoing costs for sustainability projects.
Track and document innovation in processes or designs to capture potential R&D tax credits.
Donâ€™t assume only energy credits applyâ€”assess the full range of tax incentives when sizing sustainability investments.

items.title: Why data is critical to sustainable supply chains

ai.summary: Based on the available description, David Linich of PwC US explains that reliable, high-quality data enables organizations to scenario plan, protect margins, and deliver sustainable, high-quality products at the right place and time amid constant supply-chain disruption. With conditions changing week by week, he emphasizes that data-driven decision-making is critical to building resilient, modern supply chains.
bullets: Data is essential to manage disruptions like shifting tariffs and margin pressure.
Reliable, high-quality data enables effective scenario planning.
Data helps protect margins while supporting sustainable, timely product delivery.
Rapidly changing conditions (week by week) make data-driven decisions critical.
PwC offers ongoing insights on sustainability, strategy, and operational resilience.
takeaways: Ensure access to reliable, high-quality supply-chain data to support scenario planning and rapid decisions.
Use data-driven analysis to anticipate and mitigate tariff shifts and margin pressures.
Leverage data to verify sustainable sourcing and timely delivery of critical supplies.
Implement processes that deliver up-to-date data week-to-week to strengthen operational resilience.

items.title: Bringing In $251K A Year With 3 Jobs In The Bay Area

ai.summary: Based on the available description, CNBC Make It profiles Naseema McElroy, a 44-year-old labor and delivery nurse in Brentwood, California who also runs the personal finance brand Financially Intentional and earns $251K a year across three jobs. The piece recounts that she accumulated nearly $1 million in debt by 2015, documented her debt-payoff journey, and became debt-free by 2017.
